headline: Baked Sweet Potatoes
description: This baked sweet potato recipe is easy to make and uses a simple seasoning of oregano, salt, and pepper to make a quick, family-friendly side dish.

video.description: See a healthier take on classic baked potatoes.
video.name: Baked Sweet Potatoes

name: Baked Sweet Potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat the bottom of a glass or nonstick baking dish with olive oil, just enough to coat.
Wash and peel sweet potatoes; cut into medium pieces.
Place in the baking dish and stir to coat with olive oil. Sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven until soft and fork-tender, about 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: The video was very helpful. So simple, but many of the best recipes are! I made smaller, bite-sized chunks and I omitted oregano, not a fan personally. The temp and timing were great though. Crisp and chewy corners, perfectly soft inside. Hub asked that we make this a regular in our vegetable rotation. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because I made minor adjustments.
Super recipe
This recipe was simple and delicious. Other people who tried it loved it too.
Easy and foolproof. I now make this all the time!
I make them all the time. Super easy and delicious. I just throw them in a bowl and mix them around to ensure they are coated, add salt, pepper and oregano and they are perfection! People ADORE them
Delicious. The family was asking for the recipe
No mods here, did it exactly as called for. Turned out amazing.
Made tonight, exactly as written in the instructions. Really good and a nice, simple go-to recipe for the future. Seems healthy too.
Delicious!

I made this tonight. It was surprisingly good! And such a welcome relief to sugary sweet potato recipes! 

A few things: I changed it to rosemary like many said. After eating it, I can't imagine using oregano instead. I also followed another reviewers note to microwave the potatoes to soften them for easier peeling... and I nuked them too much. (I did 3 minutes, all 3 were still solid, so 3 minutes more - partly mushy and I burned my hand. Note: I did poke holes before nuking because you don't want them to explode. ) 

tl;dr - They were good and I will make them again (with rosemary).

I cut up the potatoes very small and cooked even a little longer than the recipe called for and they were still a bit hard. I didn’t love the oregano flavor with them either. I wouldn’t make these again.
Tried this following the recipe and thoroughly enjoyed it! I definitely will be making it again. Healthy and tasty!
next time use rosemary that is from a jar. the fresh , although taste is good, the large pieces I ate played havoc on my gut all night.
So good! I cut the sweet potato into smaller pieces and cooked for 40min. Turned out perfect and the entire family loves it
So perfectly excellent!

I just use the oregano and olive oil and it's delish. I do cut it into pieces or strips and then microwave it for whatever size potato it is and then either grill or cook in the oven for half the time and it turns out great and is done sooner. But is delish!
Simple, healthy.
Very good

This was very good and easy. I lay them under a 6 lb chicken and roasted them together. They were fine though the they had to cook 2 hours. I sprinkled them with rosemary instead of oregano since thats what I was using in the chicken. I didnt like the slight sweet potato taste in the gravy. I think I would do them again like this.
I cooked mine about 20 minutes longer to crisp up some of the potatoes. And who knew that oregano went with sweet potatoes?
i made this and added a touch of cinnamon
Great recipe for a healthy side dish. My daughter asked to have this again and will plan to pack it in her lunch for Highschool.
Very simple. Very tasty healthy alternative to white potatoes.
My daughter said they were the best sweet potatoes she had ever eaten & I already made it twice and may do it often since it’s sooo easy!!
loved it!
I had sweet potato fries on hand so I decided to use those. Mixed it with the oil and seasonings and baked it in the oven. Turned out fine.
Used zucchini noodles instead, it was delicious! Threw in more pepper flakes than it called for, but I prefer spicier food

I followed the recipe but only used one large potato for the 2 of us...big mistake, we were fighting for the last bite. Next time I will bake 2 large sweet potatoes. Excellent recipe. My fiancé already said he wants this again soon. Thank you for a great side!

No changes because the first time I make a recipe I follow it as it is presented. I will make it again for sure and add a little more oregano. For me having struggled with liking sweet potatoes it is a gift.

Absolutely delicious sweet potato recipe. I roasted them on a prepared baking sheet and turned them over half way through to crisp them. Just before serving, I squeezed a few drops of fresh lemon juice over them. Everyone was amazed at how much subtle flavor the lemon juice added.
This dish was tasteless; I’ll never make it again.
I used onion powder and garlic instead of oregano. Also drizzled a teeny bit of margarine over them. Muy Bueno!
I accidentally added basil and oregano, and it was amazing!
Needed to be cooked a little under an hour for me. Very tasty recipe!
Wonderful! And LOVE the reviewer's suggestion of peeling, then microwaving for 2 minutes...Chopping was easy! I also added chopped onions...love this.

Made as outlined, but did add a small onion, cut in chunks.
I had white skinned, white pulp sweet potatoes I needed to use. 
I did use a plastic bag to coat the potatoes and onion, but ensured I only used the "pinch" of spices suggested. Oops! I did use seasoned salt, but added regular salt after baking (I like salt, no excuses).
I was surprised and delighted by how great this turned out.
Scrambled some eggs, wrapped it all in tortillas, and never looked back. Yum!

I don't even like sweet potatoes unless they have brown sugar and butter on them. This recipe changed my mind. Easy and very tasty. Followed the recipe exactly. No more brown sugar. Thanks for sharing it. Will definitely make again.
made it with no changes and it was delicious.

Used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil. Added garlic powder and rosemary to the seasonings. Cooked it in an Airfryer. The standard cooking time from Airfryer left them cooked but not crispy. Increased time to 20 minutes on 2nd batch and that made them crispier and more to my liking.
Easy and delicious!
These came out really good. Very glad I tried.
A great alternative to oven baked french fries. Will definitely make it again!
I don't like my sweet potatoes loaded with a bunch of other sweets. I found this recipe to be simply perfect!
Wonderful recipe! Made it with rosemary, and it was delish!
Used 5 sweet potatoes, microwaved for about 8 minutes first, cut into smaller 1.5-2" size chunks, swapped the oregano for rosemary. Came out perfectly cooked in 45 mins

The recipe was very vague, from the size to cut the potatoes to how to arrange them in a casserole (layered or single), to how much seasoning. I put them in a casserole dish and they were slightly layered. I tossed the potatoes throughout the hour and ended up still having to microwave them to get them done. I put them back in the oven to see if they would slightly crisp (which they didn't). They had brown marks that weren't there when I cut them up (perhaps from the oregano?). They were pretty bland and a real disappointment!! I would not make them again!
Nice! Added some parsley as well. Texture was great.

These were a wonderful addition to Thanksgiving and super easy to prepare. I cut the sweet potatoes into about 1' chunks (or a little bigger) and added fresh chopped rosemary and thyme to the potatoes, along with the salt and pepper. After the turkey was out, I popped these potatoes in, turned the oven up to 400', and they were done in about 30 minutes.

Trying what this reviewer suggested: "I cut the potatoes into smaller pieces, about an inch. They only took about 40 minutes to cook. I was out of oregano, so I just stuck with the olive oil, salt and pepper, but I added 2 garlic cloves (crushed), and half of a yellow onion, diced."
Super easy crowd pleaser

I agree wholeheartedly with the others who said they were delighted to find a sweet potato recipe that did not require cinnamon! My husband and I LOVED these! And they were so quick and easy to prepare. I did, like others, cut the pieces smaller (about an inch and a half), and shaved a few minutes off the baking time. Otherwise, I followed the recipe. SUPERB side dish!
Very easy to make, healthy and tastey.
delicious
Nice flavor, came out nice & soft, but dry on the outsides. I will flip a couple of times during cooking to keep the oil fresh and the outsides moist.
I added lots of lemon (2). That led to an exceptional taste. Enjoyed making. & everyone enjoyed eating!

I added sea salt and a tiny bit of garlic powder....I was amazed at how it turned out and how really delicious the "Italian" herbs were with the mellow sweetness of the potatoes. This is a winner ( and incredibly simple)
I made it for meal prep for the week, I think they were sweeter and more tender after reheat.
Made it as written. Was perfect. Will make it again.
These were super easy and super delicious! Will be making the
Really good recipe. We used rosemary rather than oregano, and felt it did need to be tossed with a little butter before serving.
I’ve made it a few times for the wife and I. Making it again as I post this. Pure deliciousness!
This was a hit! I made them to go with a pork loin roast and it was a great combination. Also very easy to make. Delicious.
Every one at the table loved this! We often eat sweet potatoes in”the skins” but this was just easier!

So refreshing to finally have a sweet potato recipe that isn't sweet! I love to bake sweet potatoes on a regular basis but I always find that my family wants them sweetened in some way. These came out perfectly seasoned. I did not have to change anything in the recipe and they actually enjoyed them. I did add an extra teaspoon of olive oil to coat the potatoes because I did not have any medium-sized sweet potatoes on hand. All of mine were super huge, so I had to accommodate the oil measurements to make sure they were coated well. Great recipe! We will definitely be making this one again!
It was good, didn’t amaze me. I’ve always felt sweet potatoes weren’t the best. I think I’d prefer more taste to mine that just salt and pepper.
Absolutely delicious and so easy! Thanks for sharing a wonderful recipe! It feels like I am eating dessert!
I wouldn’t change a thing! Loved everything about it.

I didn’t care for the oregano and I don’t particularly like Rosemary as others have suggested...sweet potatoes are pretty tasty on their own, next time I’ll just do the punches of salt and pepper. Overall came out wonderfully and I had 4 kids all eating it and happy about eating something healthy!
These were delicious! My 15 year old daughter cooked us dinner and included these sweet potatoes. They were perfect! She cut them a little smaller so they cook faster.
It was very easy the taste was sweet I would make it again for a family side.

I've never liked sweet potatoes because the only time I've ever tried them was when they were prepared with brown sugar, syrup, etc. Just not a big fan of sweet dishes. But these were surprisingly good! Based on other reviewers, I cut into smaller 1" pieces, used ground Rosemary (personal preference), and covered for the first 30 min, uncovered for the last 20 min and were cooked perfectly! Will definitely make these again when I want a change from my favorite regular potato. Thanks for the great recipe!
We had this for Christmas lunch and it was an absolute winner. Will be doing this again...
Did not like the oregano in this dish.
I made these to go with an apple spiced pork dish. Instead of oregano I used cinnamon and garlic powder. This is the best way to get perfectly cooked sweet potatoes every time! Thanks so much!!!
I made it with basil and thyme instead of oregano. I tried it raw first and it was delicious. Great change other than candied or a baked potato.

Easy to make and absolutely excellent!

No left-overs with this dish.
Super simple to make and delicious, My family loved it. Thank you
A well sharpened knife is the key to cutting sweet potatoes !! Loved them!!
I didn't have oregano so I used Rosemary. It is absolutely delicious! It only took me 40 minutes to make
Excellent. Came out great. You must cut the potatoes about a half inch or smaller for them to be totally soft, but they are delicious. I never knew oregano would make them so good!!
these were good and simple to make.
This recipe is great! Made it for my husband & 10 year old & they loved it! Tastes delicious. I made it 3 times in one week. Thank you!
Quick, delicious and company farm raised pork perfect!
Family thought this was fabulous! Most recipes for sweet potatoes call for some type of sugar so this was a great find. This one will be back often!

Yum! I used a little more salt and these turned out amazing. I didn't have enough time to bake, so I used my potato peeler to peel and cut up into inch size pieces. I boiled for a few minutes until tender and then cooked them in a skillet with olive oil and all the seasonings until they browned really well.

I am altering my first review. I made this recipe again and followed another reviewers suggestion. I cut the potato pieces smaller and upped the salt and pepper. Also subbed rosemary and thyme for oregano and they turned out great. I will be making these again.
I did not make any changes to the baked sweet potatoes recipe. My son loved this dish.
Made it exactly as written sweet potatoes - not yams! Absolutely delicious.
It was just okay. I'll make it in a pinch again.
Made twice, as of tonight. Can't think of any improvements! ?? So good it's hard to stop eating!!
Would not make it again. Nobody liked it. Didn't feel oregano went with these potatoes.
What's not to like? Delicious recipe!
I'm not really a fan of sweet potatoes, but I tried this and even left the skins on and it was fantastic.
Easy peasy. I put the potatoes and seasoning in a Ziploc bag and shook it up for even coating. These tasted great. I'll be making this again.
Yummy! They were very easy and tasty ??
This is absolutely awesome the way it is made. Thank you.
Prepped this last night and cooked it today and it was very tasty. Even my husband, who isn't that fond of sweet potatoes said he'd like to have this dish again.
Excellent!! :)
Made this last year at Thanksgiving, making it again this Thanksgiving!
